---
title: Fulcrum Test (Femoral stress fx)
---

The "fulcrum test" refers to a special test used to rule-in a [femoral shaft stress fracture]({{< var femoral-shaft-stress-fracture.path >}}). @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020



# Technique
{{< video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k2vDNa7hW2c&pp=ygUeaG93IHRvIHBlcmZvciB0aGUgZnVsY3J1bSB0ZXN0 >}}


- Patient is seated with knees bent @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
- Clinician places arm under symptomatic thigh @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
- With the opposite hand, the clinician applies a gentle downward pressure from distal thigh/knee (into hip extension) @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020

# Grading
Sharp pain or apprehension when the fulcrum arm is placed under the fracture site is considered a positive test @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020




# Validity

No validity research has been performed on the fulcrum test @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
